channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: PSNI review: PSNI chief faces Policing Board amid memorial row
item.description: A controversial review of policing in south Armagh led to calls for Simon Byrne to resign.

item.title: Afghanistan: Londonderry-based man says sister abducted in Kabul
item.description: Muhammad Edrees Kharotai wanted to get his family out of Afghanistan and bring them to Northern Ireland.

item.title: Northern Ireland weather: Third-warmest summer since records began
item.description: The average temperature was 15.06C, setting this summer behind 2006 and 1995 on the all-time list.

item.title: Some children in NI still waiting for post-primary school place
item.description: It comes after grammar schools did not use transfer tests to decide which pupils to admit this year.

item.title: Sinn Féin: teddy bears' picnic rules 'must apply to bonfires'
item.description: Sinn Féin say bonfires on council property in Belfast should be subject to detailed application process.

item.title: Brian Phelan: Murder trial under way after stabbing
item.description: Father-of-two Brian Phelan died after being stabbed on a rural road near Newry in 2018.

item.title: Portugal 2-1 Republic of Ireland
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo breaks the men's international goals record with two late headers as Portugal snatch a 2-1 win over luckless Republic of Ireland.

item.title: Covid-19: Nine more Covid-linked deaths and 1,472 new cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,373.

item.title: Catholic Seaview Primary School reopens with integrated status
item.description: Seaview Primary School in Glenarm changes its status, becoming the first Catholic school to do so.

item.title: Brexit: Rules for moving goods from NI to GB delayed
item.description: The rules govern which goods qualify for "unfettered access" when moving them from NI to GB.

item.title: Brexit: Couple divided by Irish border over immigration rules
item.description: Corrinne and Brett Giles live on either side of the Irish border due to post-Brexit immigration rules.

item.title: Covid-19: Call for easing restrictions in NI addiction centres
item.description: Some people who need help are unable to access it, says the head of one treatment centre.

item.title: Deputy First Minister Michelle O'Neill tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: A meeting of the Stormont Executive on Wednesday to discuss restrictions has been postponed until next week.

item.title: Covid-19: Economy minister calls for plans to end restrictions
item.description: Economy Minister Gordon Lyons says the NI Executive needs to "start moving on these issues".

item.title: NI hospitals: 400 emergency patients wait over 12 hours for bed
item.description: A senior doctor says many of those waiting for beds are "our most vulnerable patients".

item.title: New destinations added to Northern Ireland travel green list
item.description: Seven more locations including Canada, Denmark and Switzerland are now on the green list.

item.title: Covid-19: NI pupils in contact with coronavirus case can stay in class
item.description: Staff who are fully vaccinated will also not have to self isolate if they are a close contact.

item.title: Storm names: Barra, Méabh, and Pól among names set for 2021-22
item.description: The storm names for the coming year are compiled by the British, Irish and Dutch weather services.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Troubles pensions scheme opens for applications
item.description: It offers payments to people injured during the Troubles but is more than a year behind schedule.

item.title: Brexit: What next for the Northern Ireland Protocol?
item.description: NI's economy minister says there will be "real problems" if grace periods expire on 1 October.

item.title: Afghanistan: Interpreter's family granted refugee status in Ireland
item.description: Bilal, who worked with British troops in Helmand in 2012, says his emotions are "out of this world".

item.title: The Troubles: When Belfast children fled the city
item.description: In the early years of the Troubles, thousands of people in Northern Ireland fled their homes.

item.title: South Armagh: Naomi Long asks, 'What inroads have unionists made?'
item.description: Naomi Long says parties should "move back" from calls for Simon Byrne to resign over a policing review.

item.title: PSNI chief 'has lost the confidence of unionists', says DUP leader
item.description: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson is to meet Simon Byrne on Thursday over a review into policing in south Armagh.

item.title: Economy Minister Gordon Lyons calls for plans to end restrictions
item.description: The economy minister says the regulations have had "a huge impact" on people in Northern Ireland.

item.title: PSNI's Crossmaglen station is an 'emblem of the past'
item.description: Chief Constable Simon Byrne says the south Armagh station has no place in modern policing.

item.title: Strabane: Man charged over aggravated burglary
item.description: A second man remains under arrest, while a third man arrested on Monday has been released on bail.

item.title: Paralympics: Tokyo gold 'sweetest of all' for sprinter Smyth
item.description: Jason Smyth says he crossed the line unsure if he had added to his record breaking gold medal haul.

item.title: Strabane: Man left 'badly shaken' after bat attack
item.description: Three men arrested following the incident on Monday are assisting police with their inquiries.

item.title: Derry: Man released over masked men mural gunfire
item.description: The 30-year-old man was arrested under the Terrorism Act in Londonderry on Saturday evening.

item.title: Covid-19: Irish Cabinet agrees to end most restrictions by 22 October
item.description: Ministers met on Tuesday to agree on a plan to ease most Covid-19 restrictions by 22 October.

item.title: Irish society 'can begin to hope again', says Micheál Martin
item.description: The Taoiseach (Irish prime minister) announces plan to end most Covid-19 restrictions by 22 October.

item.title: Irish population tops 5m for first time since 1851 census
item.description: There were also 742,300 people living in the Republic Ireland aged 65 and over in April, figures show.

item.title: Republic of Ireland: FAI announces equal pay for men's and women's senior teams
item.description: The Republic of Ireland men's and women's teams will receive the same match fees on international duty with immediate effect, the FAI says.

item.title: County Meath: Murder investigation after man's body found
item.description: The 19-year-old's body was found with a single gunshot wound in County Meath.
